Detailed Description

The class contains an implementation of CollectorConfigI, which reads the configuration from an XML file. The xml file has the following structure: <xmp> <IPDRcollectorConfiguration xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <Collector IP="10.1.100.81" templateNegotiation="true" supportDiscovery="false" port="4737" startInterval="30" protocolVersion="2" vendor="IPDR" acceptTimeout="30" strictTemplates="false" udpDiscoveryTimeout="3"/> <exporters> <exporter ip="10.1.100.14"> <connection type="passive" count="1" connecttimeout="100" keepalive="20" port="15200"> <description>Connection's description </description> <sessions> <session id="1" name="mySession1"> <description>Session's description1 </description> <templaterefs> <templateref ref="15"> <templateconfig> <FieldConfig keyId="1" fieldUsed="false"/> <FieldConfig keyId="2" fieldUsed="true"/> <FieldConfig keyId="3" fieldUsed="true"/> <FieldConfig keyId="4" fieldUsed="true"/> <FieldConfig keyId="5" fieldUsed="true"/> <FieldConfig keyId="6" fieldUsed="false"/> </templateconfig>

</templateref> </templaterefs> </session> </sessions> </connection> </exporter> </exporters> <templates> <template globalref="654" id="987"> <description>Template's description 1 </description> <fields> <field keyid="135" fieldused="true" keyname="myKey1" keytypeid="3"> </field> </fields> </template> </templates> </ipdrcollectorconfiguration> </xmp> The configuration file has three top-level tags: <Collector> for collector configuration, <Exporters> for exporter configuration, <Templates> for templates configuration. The collector configuration is in the attributes of <Collector> element:

IP
Collector IP address
port
Collector listening TCP port
templateNegotiation
Template negotiation capability
supportDiscovery
UDP discovery support
startInterval
Start interval for connection spawning
protocolVersion
Collector default protocol version
vendor
Vendor string
acceptTimeout
Accept timeout
strictTemplates
Strict templates flag
udpDiscoveryTimeout
Timeout for UDP discovery
udpDiscoveryPort
UDP port for incoming discovery requests

Each exporter is represented as a <Exporter> element. It has a single attribute, IP, which contains its IP address. Specific connections of an exporter are configured in child <Connection> elements. Each <Connection> element has the following attributes:

type
"active" or "passive", according to the connection type
count
Maximum count for the connection. Only meaningful for passive connections.
connectTimeOut
Connect timeout
retryCount
Number of connection attempt retries. Defaults to infinite
retryInterval
Interval between connection retries
keepAlive
Expected keepalive timeout
port
TCP port to connect to. Only meaningful for active connections.

Under each <Connection> element, there is a <Description> child element which contains verbal description of the connection. There also is a <Sessions> tag, which contains list of session on this connection. Each such session is represented as <Session> element. The <Session> element has the following attributes:

id
Numeric id of the session
name
Name of the session
Each <Session> has a child <Description> element with verbal description of the session. It also has a child <Templates> element, which contains templates. Each template is represented by a <Template> element, which has the only attribute ref. The attribute holds an id of the template as configured below.

The <Templates> top-level element holds description of known templates. Each template is represented by a <Template> element. The tag must have an id attribute, which should hold numeric value of the template id. Under the <Template>, tags <Description> and <Fields> are expected to be found. The <Description> holds the verbal description of the template. The <Fields> tag holds enumeration of template fields. Each field is represented by a <Field> tag. Each such tag must have the following attributes:

keyId
Numeric id of the field
fieldUsed
Is the field enabled for output by default
keyName
Name of the field
keyTypeId
Type id of the field

00328     {
00329         java.util.List templates = templateConfigs.getChildren();
00330         for (int i = 0; i < templates.size(); i++)
00331         {
00332             TemplateConfig template = new TemplateConfig();
00333             // get "Template" element

00337                     templateElt, "id"));

00339                     templateElt, "globalRef"));

00341                     .getChildText("Description") );
00342             // fill "Fields" data
00343             List fields = templateElt.getChild("Fields").getChildren("Field");
00344             for (int j = 0; j < fields.size(); j++)
00345             {
00346                 // get "Field" element
00347                 Element fieldElt = (Element) fields.get(j);
00348                 FieldConfig field = new FieldConfig(XMLUtility
00349                         .getMandatoryIntAttribute(fieldElt, "keyId"),
00350                         XMLUtility.getMandatoryIntAttribute(fieldElt,
00351                                 "keyTypeId"), XMLUtility
00352                                 .getMandatoryStringAttribute(fieldElt,
00353                                         "keyName"), XMLUtility
00354                                 .getMandatoryBooleanAttribute(fieldElt,
00355                                         "fieldUsed"));
00356                 // add fieldConfig element to template data
00357                 template.addField(field);
00358             }
00359             this.templatesConfigList.add(template);
00360         }
00361     }

Fills configuration elements

Exceptions:
ConfigException 
UnknownHostException 
DataConversionException 
00236     {
00237         // get "Collector" element
00238         collector = root.getChild(XML_COLLECTOR_ELEMENT);
00239         if (collector == null)
00240                 throw new ConfigException("Invalid config file");
00241         fillCollectorData();
00242         // get "Templates" elements
00243         templateConfigs = root.getChild(XML_TEMPLATES_ELEMENT);
00244         if (templateConfigs == null)
00245                 throw new ConfigException("Invalid config file");
00246         fillTemplatesData();
00247         // get "Exporters" element
00248         exporterConfigs = root.getChild(XML_EXPORTERS_ELEMENT);
00249         if (exporterConfigs == null)
00250                 throw new ConfigException("Invalid config file");
00251         fillExportersData();
00252     }
